text: New by it's definition is unfamiliar. And the unfamiliar is scary. As humans we're biologically programmed to stay away from the unfamiliar. The familiar is safe. The familiar  is predictable. For millienia the predictable meant that you wouldn't find yourself on the wrong side of a tiger attack. But here's the great paradox of humanity. The familiar is rarely rewarded. To the pioneers go the spoils. Nobody remembers the 167th model of disc man, no matter how good the anti-skip feature was, but everybody remembers the iPod.
